headline: Does Rising Memory Costs And Soft Printing Demand Change The Bull Case For HP (HPQ)?
summary: In late February 2026, HP Inc. reported first-quarter fiscal 2026 results showing net revenue of US$14.44 billion, up from US$13.50 billion a year earlier, while maintaining full-year GAAP EPS guidance of US$2.47–US$2.77 despite margin pressure from sharply higher memory costs and trade-related headwinds. The company’s Personal Systems momentum, including growing AI PC shipments, contrasted with weaker Printing trends and rising component costs, prompting management to flag that earnings are...
